title: Jitter Plot — JitterPlot
text: Jittered point plot optional background, highlight, labels faceting.

title: Jitter Plot — JitterPlot
code: JitterPlot(   data,   x,   x_sep = "_",   y = NULL,   in_form = c("long", "wide"),   split_by = NULL,   split_by_sep = "_",   sort_x = c("none", "mean_asc", "mean_desc", "mean", "median_asc", "median_desc",     "median"),   flip = FALSE,   keep_empty = FALSE,   group_by = NULL,   group_by_sep = "_",   group_name = NULL,   x_text_angle = 0,   order_by = "-({y}^2 + {size_by}^2)",   theme = "theme_this",   theme_args = list(),   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   alpha = 1,   aspect.ratio = NULL,   legend.position = "right",   legend.direction = "vertical",   shape = 21,   border = "black",   size_by = 2,   size_name = NULL,   size_trans = NULL,   y_nbreaks = 4,   jitter_width = 0.5,   jitter_height = 0,   y_max = NULL,   y_min = NULL,   y_trans = "identity",   add_bg = FALSE,   bg_palette = "stripe",   bg_palcolor = NULL,   bg_alpha = 0.2,   add_hline = NULL,   hline_type = "solid",   hline_width = 0.5,   hline_color = "black",   hline_alpha = 1,   labels = NULL,   label_by = NULL,   nlabel = 5,   label_size = 3,   label_fg = "black",   label_bg = "white",   label_bg_r = 0.1,   highlight = NULL,   highlight_color = "red2",   highlight_size = 1,   highlight_alpha = 1,   facet_by = NULL,   facet_scales = "fixed",   facet_ncol = NULL,   facet_nrow = NULL,   facet_byrow = TRUE,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   seed = 8525,   combine = TRUE,   nrow = NULL,   ncol = NULL,   byrow = TRUE,   axes = NULL,   axis_titles = axes,   guides = NULL,   design = NULL,   ... )

title: Jitter Plot — JitterPlot
text: data data frame. x character string column name plot x-axis. character/factor column expected. multiple columns provided, columns concatenated x_sep. x_sep character string concatenate columns x, multiple columns provided. in_form "wide", x columns concatenated. y character string column name plot y-axis. numeric column expected. in_form "wide", y required. values x columns used y-values. in_form character string specify input data type. Either "long" "wide". split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by sort_x character string specify sorting x-axis, chosen "none", "mean_asc", "mean_desc", "mean", "median_asc", "median_desc", "median". none means sorting (-). mean_asc sorts x-axis ascending mean y-values. mean_desc sorts x-axis descending mean y-values. mean alias mean_asc. median_asc sorts x-axis ascending median y-values. median_desc sorts x-axis descending median y-values. median alias median_asc. flip logical value flip plot. keep_empty logical value keep empty levels x-axis. group_by character string dodge points. group_by_sep character string concatenate columns group_by, multiple columns provided. group_name character string name legend dodge. x_text_angle numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. order_by string expression passed dplyr::arrange() order data get top nlabel points labeling. Default -({y}^2 + {size_by}^2) (similar VolcanoPlot). theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). alpha Point transparency. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. shape numeric value specify point shape. Shapes 21–25 borders; border behavior controlled border. border logical character value specify border points shape border (21–25). TRUE, border color follows point color (fill). color string, uses constant border color. FALSE, border. size_by numeric column name single numeric value point size. column, sizes scaled (see scatter plots). size_name Legend title size size_by column. size_trans function name global function transform size_by (size_by column). legend shows original (untransformed) values. jitter_width, jitter_height Jitter parameters. y_max, y_min Numeric quantile strings ("q95", "q5") y limits computation (used fixed coord). y_trans, y_nbreaks Axis settings. add_bg logical value add background plot. bg_palette character string specify palette background. bg_palcolor character vector specify colors background. bg_alpha numeric value specify transparency background. add_hline Add one horizontal reference lines given y-value(s). hline_type line type horizontal reference line(s). hline_width line width horizontal reference line(s). hline_color color horizontal reference line(s). hline_alpha alpha horizontal reference line(s). labels vector row names indices label points. label_by character column name use label text. NULL, rownames used. nlabel Number points label per x-group labels NULL (top y^2 + size^2). label_size, label_fg, label_bg, label_bg_r Label aesthetics. highlight, highlight_color, highlight_size, highlight_alpha Highlighted point options. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments.

title: Jitter Plot — JitterPlot
text: Jitter plot(s). split_by provided, returns ggplot object. split_by provided, returns object plots wrapped patchwork::wrap_plots combine = TRUE; otherwise, returns list ggplot objects.

title: Jitter Plot — JitterPlot
code: # \donttest{ set.seed(8525) n <- 200 x <- sample(LETTERS[1:5], n, replace = TRUE) group <- sample(c("G1", "G2"), n, replace = TRUE) size <- rexp(n, rate = 1) id <- paste0("pt", seq_len(n)) y <- rnorm(n, mean = ifelse(group == "G1", 0.5, -0.5)) +      as.numeric(factor(x, levels = LETTERS[1:5]))/10 df <- data.frame(   x = factor(x, levels = LETTERS[1:5]),   y = y,   group = group,   size = size,   id = id )  # Basic JitterPlot(df, x = "x", y = "y")   # Map size with transform; legend shows original values JitterPlot(df, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "size", size_name = "Abundance",     size_trans = sqrt, order_by = "-y^2")   # Dodge by group and add a horizontal line JitterPlot(df, x = "x", y = "y", group_by = "group",   add_hline = 0, hline_type = "dashed", hline_color = "red2")   # Label top points by distance (y^2 + size^2) JitterPlot(df, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "size", label_by = "id", nlabel = 3)   # Flip axes JitterPlot(df, x = "x", y = "y", flip = TRUE)  # }

text: family_only list font family names. source Source fonts include. Can one "builtin", "system", "google", "". Default "".

text: list font family names, names source fonts (system google) family_only TRUE. family_only FALSE, returns data frame font family names paths.#'

title: List fonts — list_fonts
text: inspired plummy package. fonts automatically imported used theme_this(), typically via theme_args argument plotting functions. example, BarPlot(..., theme_args = list(font_family = "Barlow")). can also use import_font("Barlow") import font manually using plots separately. example, BarPlot(...) + theme(text = element_text(family = "Barlow")). See import_font() details importing fonts.

what: Expand the plot area with CSS-like padding — norm_expansion
title: Expand the plot area with CSS-like padding — norm_expansion
text: Expand plot area CSS-like padding

title: Expand the plot area with CSS-like padding — norm_expansion
code: norm_expansion(   expand,   x_type,   y_type,   continuous_default = c(0.05, 0),   discrete_default = c(0, 0.6) )

title: Expand the plot area with CSS-like padding — norm_expansion
text: expand numeric vector length 1, 2, 3, 4 values expand x y axes. like CSS padding. single value provided, used axes sides. two values provided, first value used top/bottom side second value used left/right side. three values provided, first value used top side, second value used left/right side, third value used bottom side. four values provided, values used top, right, bottom, left sides, respectively. can also use named vector specify values side. axis discrete, values applied 'add' 'expansion' function. axis continuous, values applied 'mult' 'expansion' function. See also https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/expansion.html x_type type x-axis, either "continuous" "discrete" y_type type y-axis, either "continuous" "discrete"

title: Expand the plot area with CSS-like padding — norm_expansion
text: list x y values expand

viridis_names <- c("magma", "inferno", "plasma", "viridis", "cividis", "rocket",      "mako", "turbo")   viridis_palettes <- lapply(setNames(viridis_names, viridis_names),      function(x) jcolors_names, names(seurat_palettes),     names(seurat_continuous_palettes), custom_names   )   for (pal in all_colors) {     if (!pal %in% all_colors) {       stop(paste0("Invalid pal Must be one of ", paste0(all_colors, collapse = ",")))     }     if (pal %in% rownames(brewer.pal.info)) {       pal_n <- brewer.pal.info[pal, "maxcolors"]       pal_category <- brewer.pal.info[pal, "category"] {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(ggsci_db)) {       if (pal %in% c("d3", "uchicago", "material")) {         for (subpal in names(ggsci_db[[pal]])) "discrete"           }           palette_list[[paste0(pal, "-", subpal)]] <- palcolor         }         next       } else {         palcolor <- ggsci_db[[pal]][[1]]         if (pal == "gsea") { else {         palcolor <- redmonder.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       }       if (pal_category == "qual") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% rownames(metacartocolors)) {       pal_n <- metacartocolors[pal, "Max_n"]       palcolor <- carto_pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       if (pal_category == "qualitative") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(nord_palettes)) {       palcolor <- nord_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"     } else if (pal %in% names(viridis_palettes)) {       palcolor <- viridis_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     } else if (pal %in% names(ocean_palettes)) {       palcolor <- ocean_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     } else if (pal %in% names(dichromat_palettes)) {       palcolor <- dichromat_palettes[[pal]]       if (pal %in% c("Categorical.12", "SteppedSequential.5")) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% jcolors_names) {       palcolor <- jcolors(palette = gsub("jcolors-", "", pal))       if (pal %in% paste0("jcolors-", c("pal10", "pal11", "pal12", "rainbow"))) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       }     } else if (pal %in% custom_names) {       palcolor <- custom_palettes[[pal]]       if (pal %in% c("jet")) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(seurat_discrete_palettes)) {       palcolor <- seurat_discrete_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"     } else if (pal %in% names(seurat_continuous_palettes)) {       palcolor <- seurat_continuous_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     }     palette_list[[pal]] <- palcolor   } } # }

Default TRUE. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments.

title: Sankey / Alluvial Plot — SankeyPlot
text: ggplot object wrap_plots object list ggplot objects

title: Sankey / Alluvial Plot — SankeyPlot
code: # \donttest{ # Reproduce the examples in ggalluvial set.seed(8525)  data(UCBAdmissions, package = "datasets") UCBAdmissions <- as.data.frame(UCBAdmissions) SankeyPlot(as.data.frame(UCBAdmissions), x = c("Gender", "Dept"),     y = "Freq", nodes_width = 1/12, links_fill_by = "Admit", nodes_label = TRUE,     nodes_palette = "simspec", links_palette = "Set1", links_alpha = 0.5,     nodes_palcolor = "black", links_color = "transparent")   data(HairEyeColor, package = "datasets") SankeyPlot(as.data.frame(HairEyeColor), x = c("Hair", "Eye", "Sex"),     y = "Freq", links_fill_by = "Eye", nodes_width = 1/8, nodes_alpha = 0.4,     flip = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, knot.pos = 0, links_color = "transparent",     ylab = "Freq", links_alpha = 0.5, links_name = "Eye (links)", links_palcolor = c(         Brown = "#70493D", Hazel = "#E2AC76", Green = "#3F752B", Blue = "#81B0E4"))   data(Refugees, package = "alluvial") country_regions <- c(     Afghanistan = "Middle East",     Burundi = "Central Africa",     `Congo DRC` = "Central Africa",     Iraq = "Middle East",     Myanmar = "Southeast Asia",     Palestine = "Middle East",     Somalia = "Horn of Africa",     Sudan = "Central Africa",     Syria = "Middle East",     Vietnam = "Southeast Asia" ) Refugees$region <- country_regions[Refugees$country] SankeyPlot(Refugees, x = "year", y = "refugees", alluvium = "country",     links_fill_by = "country", links_color = ".fill", links_alpha = 0.75,     links_palette = "Set3", facet_by = "region", x_text_angle = -45, nodes_legend = "none",     theme_args = list(strip.background = ggplot2::element_rect(fill="grey80")),     decreasing = FALSE, nodes_width = 0, nodes_color = "transparent", ylab = "refugees",     title = "Refugee volume by country and region of origin")   data(majors, package = "ggalluvial") majors$curriculum <- as.factor(majors$curriculum) SankeyPlot(majors, x = "semester", stratum = "curriculum", alluvium = "student",     links_fill_by = "curriculum", flow = TRUE, stat = "alluvium", nodes_palette = "Set2",     links_palette = "Set2")   data(vaccinations, package = "ggalluvial") vaccinations <- transform(vaccinations,     response = factor(response, rev(levels(response)))) SankeyPlot(vaccinations, x = "survey", stratum = "response", alluvium = "subject",     y = "freq", links_fill_by = "response", nodes_label = TRUE, nodes_alpha = 0.5,     nodes_palette = "seurat", links_palette = "seurat", links_alpha = 0.5,     legend.position = "none", flow = TRUE, expand = c(0, 0, 0, .15), stat = "alluvium",     title = "vaccination survey responses at three points in time")   data(Titanic, package = "datasets") SankeyPlot(as.data.frame(Titanic), x = c("Class", "Sex"), y = "Freq",     links_fill_by = "Survived", flow = TRUE, facet_by = "Age", facet_scales = "free_y",     nodes_label = TRUE, expand = c(0.05, 0), xlab = "", links_palette = "Set1",     nodes_palcolor = "white", nodes_label_miny = 10)   # Simulated examples df <- data.frame(     Clone = paste0("clone", 1:10),     Timepoint1 = sample(c(rep(0, 30), 1:100), 10),     Timepoint2 = sample(c(rep(0, 30), 1:100), 10) ) SankeyPlot(df, x = c("Timepoint1", "Timepoint2"), alluvium = "Clone",     links_color = ".fill")   df <- data.frame(     Clone = rep(paste0("clone", 1:6), each = 2),     Timepoint1 = sample(c(rep(0, 30), 1:100), 6),     Timepoint2 = sample(c(rep(0, 30), 1:100), 6),     Group = rep(c("A", "B"), 6) ) SankeyPlot(df, x = c(".", "Timepoint1", "Timepoint2"),     stratum = "Group", links_fill_by = "Clone", links_color = ".fill")  # }

title: Plots for spatial elements — SpatImagePlot
text: data SpatRaster SpatVector object terra package, data.frame SpatShapesPlot SpatPointsPlot. ext terra's SpatExtent object numeric vector length 4 specifying extent c(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax). Default NULL. raster Whether raster plot. Default NULL. raster_dpi numeric vector raster dpi. Default c(512, 512). flip_y Whether flip y-axis direction. Default TRUE. useful visualizing spatial data origin top left corner. palette character string specifying color palette use. SpatImagePlot, data 3 channels (RGB), used color identity argument ignored. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). palette_reverse Whether reverse color palette. Default FALSE. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. fill_name character string fill legend title. return_layer Whether return layers plot. Default FALSE. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. seed random seed use. Default 8525. add_border Whether add border around masks SpatMasksPlot. Default TRUE. border_color character string border color. Default "black". border_size numeric value border width. Default 0.5. border_alpha numeric value border transparency. Default 1. x character string specifying x-axis column name SpatPointsPlot SpatShapesPlot data data.frame. data SpatRaster SpatVector, argument ignored. y character string specifying y-axis column name SpatPointsPlot SpatShapesPlot data data.frame. data SpatRaster SpatVector, argument ignored. group character string specifying grouping column SpatShapesPlot data data.frame. fill_by character string vector specifying column(s) fill shapes SpatShapesPlot. highlight character vector row names highlight. Default NULL. highlight_alpha numeric value highlight transparency. Default 1. highlight_size numeric value highlight size. Default 1. highlight_color character string highlight color. Default "black". highlight_stroke numeric value highlight stroke. Default 0.8. facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. color_by character string specifying column color points SpatPointsPlot. size_by character string specifying column size points SpatPointsPlot. size Alias size_by size numeric value. lower_quantile, upper_quantile, lower_cutoff, upper_cutoff Vector minimum maximum cutoff values quantile values numeric value. color_name character string color legend title SpatPointsPlot. size_name character string size legend title SpatPointsPlot. shape numeric value character string specifying shape points SpatPointsPlot. hex Whether use hex plot. Default FALSE. hex_linewidth numeric value hex line width. Default 0.5. hex_count Whether count hex. hex_bins numeric value hex bins. Default 50. hex_binwidth numeric value hex bin width. Default NULL. label Whether show labels groups. Default FALSE. label_size numeric value label size. Default 4. label_fg character string label foreground color. Default "white". label_bg character string label background color. Default "black". label_bg_r numeric value background ratio labels. Default 0.1. label_repel Whether repel labels. Default FALSE. label_repulsion numeric value label repulsion. Default 20. label_pt_size numeric value label point size. Default 1. label_pt_color character string label point color. Default "black". label_segment_color character string label segment color. Default "black". label_insitu Whether place raw labels (group names) center points corresponding group. Default FALSE, uses numbers instead raw labels. label_pos character string function specifying position labels. "mean": Place labels mean position points group. function(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE). "center": Place labels center points group. function(x) mean(range(x, na.rm = TRUE)). "median": Place labels median position points group. function(x) median(x, na.rm = TRUE). "first": Place labels first point group. function(x) x[1]. "last": Place labels last point group. function(x) x[length(x)]. "random": Place labels random point group. function(x) sample(x, 1). "min": Place labels minimum position (x y) points group. function(x) min(x, na.rm = TRUE). "max": Place labels maximum position (x y) points group. function(x) max(x, na.rm = TRUE). graph character string column names indexes data graph data. Default NULL. "@graph" provided, graph data extracted data attribute 'graph'. graph data adjacency matrix (numeric matrix) row column names matching point IDs. data.frame x, xend, y, yend value columns. , graph_x, graph_y, graph_xend, graph_yend, graph_value arguments can used specify column names. graph_x character string x column name graph data. graph_y character string y column name graph data. graph_xend character string xend column name graph data. graph_yend character string yend column name graph data. graph_value character string value column name graph data. edge_size numeric vector edge size range. Default c(0.05, 0.5). edge_alpha numeric value edge transparency. Default 0.1. edge_color character string edge color. Default "grey40".

title: Plots for spatial elements — SpatImagePlot
code: # \donttest{ set.seed(8525) # --- SpatImagePlot --- # Generate a sample SpatRaster r <- terra::rast(     nrows = 50, ncols = 40, vals = runif(2000),     xmin = 0, xmax = 40, ymin = 0, ymax = 50,     crs = "" ) SpatImagePlot(r)  SpatImagePlot(r, raster = TRUE, raster_dpi = 20)  SpatImagePlot(r, alpha = 0.5, theme = "theme_blank",     theme_args = list(add_coord = FALSE), fill_name = "value")  SpatImagePlot(r, ext = c(0, 10, 0, 10), flip_y = FALSE, palette = "viridis")   # --- SpatMasksPlot --- m <- terra::rast(    nrows = 50, ncols = 40,    vals = sample(c(1:5, NA), 2000, replace = TRUE, prob = c(rep(0.04, 5), 0.8)),    xmin = 0, xmax = 40, ymin = 0, ymax = 50,    crs = "" ) SpatMasksPlot(m, border_color = "red")  SpatMasksPlot(m, ext = c(0, 15, 0, 20), add_border = FALSE,     palette_reverse = TRUE, fill_name = "value") #> Warning: Raster pixels are placed at uneven horizontal intervals and will be shifted #> ℹ Consider using `geom_tile()` instead.   # --- SpatShapesPlot --- polygons <- data.frame(    id = paste0("poly_", 1:10),    cat = sample(LETTERS[1:3], 10, replace = TRUE),    feat1 = rnorm(10),    feat2 = rnorm(10),    geometry = c(        'POLYGON((64.6 75.3,66.0 70.5,66.4 70.2,67.0 69.8,72.8 70.4,64.6 75.3))',        'POLYGON((56.7 63.0,52.3 65.6,48.0 63.2,51.2 55.7,57.1 59.2,56.7 63.0))',        'POLYGON((9.9 16.5,9.3 15.9,8.0 13.1,11.5 7.8,17.8 11.3,9.9 16.5))',        'POLYGON((64.9 37.2,60.3 37.4,57.6 31.7,58.9 29.3,64.0 28.1,64.9 37.2))',        'POLYGON((30.5 49.1,22.4 46.5,22.4 43.9,30.9 41.9,31.6 42.9,30.5 49.1))',        'POLYGON((78.3 57.8,70.5 61.6,71.6 52.7,72.2 52.5,77.4 54.5,78.3 57.8))',        'POLYGON((41.8 23.8,41.3 25.9,41.0 26.4,36.5 28.7,35.8 28.6,41.8 23.8))',        'POLYGON((15.7 75.9,14.2 74.4,15.7 67.5,23.0 69.8,23.4 71.7,15.7 75.9))',        'POLYGON((80.7 37.4,75.3 31.3,77.1 28.5,82.5 28.0,83.1 28.5,80.7 37.4))',        'POLYGON((15.5 37.8,14.4 38.6,7.3 32.6,8.3 30.9,15.1 30.2,15.5 37.8))'    ) )  polygons <- terra::vect(polygons, crs = "EPSG:4326", geom = "geometry")  SpatShapesPlot(polygons)  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, ext = c(0, 20, 0, 20))  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, highlight = 'cat == "A"', highlight_color = "red2")  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, border_color = "red", border_size = 2)  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, fill_by = "cat", fill_name = "category")  # Let border color be determined by fill SpatShapesPlot(polygons, fill_by = "cat", alpha = 0.6, border_color = TRUE)  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, fill_by = "feat1")  SpatShapesPlot(polygons, fill_by = c("feat1", "feat2"), palette = "RdYlBu")   # --- SpatPointsPlot --- # create some random points in the above polygons points <- data.frame(   id = paste0("point_", 1:30),   gene = sample(LETTERS[1:3], 30, replace = TRUE),   feat1 = runif(30, 0, 100),   feat2 = runif(30, 0, 100),   size = runif(30, 1, 5),   x = c(     61.6, 14.3, 12.7, 49.6, 74.9, 58.9, 13.9, 24.7, 16.9, 15.6,     72.4, 60.1, 75.4, 14.9, 80.3, 78.8, 16.7, 27.6, 48.9, 52.5,     12.9, 11.8, 50.4, 25.6, 10.4, 51.9, 73.4, 26.8, 50.4, 60.0   ),   y = c(     32.1, 12.8, 33.2, 59.9, 57.8, 31.9, 10.1, 46.8, 75.3, 69.0,     60.0, 29.4, 54.2, 34.2, 35.3, 33.1, 74.7, 48.0, 63.2, 59.2,     9.2, 15.1, 64.5, 47.1, 11.4, 60.1, 54.1, 44.5, 61.9, 30.3   ) )  SpatPointsPlot(points)  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "gene", size_by = "size", shape = 22,   border_size = 1)  SpatPointsPlot(points, raster = TRUE, raster_dpi = 30, color_by = "feat1")  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = c("feat1", "feat2"), size_by = "size")  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "feat1", upper_cutoff = 50)  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "feat1", hex = TRUE)  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "gene", label = TRUE)  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "gene", highlight = 1:20,   highlight_color = "red2", highlight_stroke = 0.8)   # --- Graph/Network functionality --- # Create a simple adjacency matrix for demonstration set.seed(8525) graph_mat <- matrix(0, nrow = 30, ncol = 30) # Add some random connections with weights for(i in 1:30) {   neighbors <- sample(setdiff(1:30, i), size = sample(2:5, 1))   graph_mat[i, neighbors] <- runif(length(neighbors), 0.1, 1) } rownames(graph_mat) <- colnames(graph_mat) <- rownames(points) attr(points, "graph") <- graph_mat  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "gene", graph = "@graph",   edge_color = "grey60", edge_alpha = 0.3)  SpatPointsPlot(points, color_by = "feat1", graph = graph_mat,   edge_size = c(0.1, 1), edge_alpha = 0.5)   # --- Use the `return_layer` argument to get the ggplot layers ext = c(0, 40, 0, 50) ggplot2::ggplot() +   SpatImagePlot(r, return_layer = TRUE, alpha = 0.2, ext = ext) +   SpatShapesPlot(polygons, return_layer = TRUE, ext = ext, fill_by = "white") +   SpatPointsPlot(points, return_layer = TRUE, ext = ext, color_by = "feat1") +   theme_box() +   ggplot2::coord_sf(expand = 0) +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) -x)   # }

title: Validate common arguments — validate_common_args
text: seed random seed use. Default 8525. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by group_by Columns group data plotting plotting functions support multiple groups, concatenated one column, using group_by_sep separator group_by_sep separator multiple group_by columns. See group_by facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). expand values expand x y axes. like CSS padding. single value provided, used axes sides. two values provided, first value used top/bottom side second value used left/right side. three values provided, first value used top side, second value used left/right side, third value used bottom side. four values provided, values used top, right, bottom, left sides, respectively. can also use named vector specify values side. axis discrete, values applied 'add' 'expansion' function. axis continuous, values applied 'mult' 'expansion' function. See also https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/expansion.html keep_empty logical value indicating whether keep empty groups. FALSE, empty groups removed. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. x_text_angle numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. ... Additional arguments.
